Tucson turns to Rodimus throughtfully.  He too had never attempted a power =
link.

" Truthfully Rodimus, I really don't know if I'm capable of it.  It'=
s just something Straight Shot brought up to me...  If anyone knows about P=
owerlinking, maybe she does."

Straight Shot looks to them and takes a seat=
.

" You're right, I really should explain it better to you guys.  I read u=
p on it somewhere in some old Cybertronian Archives, when Tucson and I were=
 just average Autobots.  It was our favorite past time, ta do research, and=
 look up ancient records and artifacts.  Well, in one of those articles, I =
found something about powerlinking.  And what I read, it stated that becaus=
e Autobots are so well in tuned with each other, and that their bond of uni=
ty is unbroken by anyone, it's their faith in each other, that gives them t=
he power to transform and form an even stronger bond with each other.. The =
bond of merger.  That means two of you guys, comming together to form one f=
ormidable warrior.  And I don't think you guys need a rebuild.  You need a =
spiritual faith in each other, a bond that no one can break, and I know tha=
t when Tucson went looking for you Rodimus, he went looking for you with al=
l his heart.  The power to do the extraordinary, lies within your heart.  I=
 know you have it, you just have to believe in yourself, listen to your hea=
rt, and have faith in those who have faith in you."

Tucson nodds. 

" I wo=
uldn't have gone that far if I didn't think I had faith in you, Rodimus.  M=
y faith in you was renewed the day you fought off that evil hold Hydras had=
 on you.  When you could have reverted back to your evil self, you advised =
me to leave before I was destroyed in the rubble.  That took courage, and c=
ompassion.  The kind of compassion no power can break.  Not even Hydras him=
self.  You have that power Rodimus, believe in it, and it will allow you to=
 do extraordinary things."

Rat Trap walks over to Rodimus in rat mode, wit=
h a smile on his face, and ears straight up.

"You can do this Rodimus, you=
 got what it takes, no rebuilds necesary, you got it in you and now it's ti=
me ta shine."

Tucson then turns to Lord Elder and the others.

" Knowing H=
ydra's weaknesses will be a great asset.  Yes, send Cheetor out to see what=
 kind of intel he can gather for us."

He turns back to Straight Shot.

"So=
, how would one go about initilazing the powerlink?"

Straight Shot looks u=
p.

"Okay, so, this is how it works.  You state your name, and verbally giv=
e yourself the command to transform.  If Rodimus were ta try it, he'd do th=
e same.  That will initialize a transformation of both your physcial bodies=
, but not into vehicle form.  Then both of you at the same time, state "POW=
ERLINK!"  and depending on which order you chose, in this case, it would be=
 better if Rodimus were your eyes, so he'd complete the phase, by stating, =
POWERLINK, RODIMUS PRIME!"  Annnd bingo!  Two bots, form one formidable war=
rior.  You combine power, wisdom and agilitiy.  And Rodimus would be your e=
yes."

Rat Trap looks to her.

"Wow, and you read this from an old intel fi=
le somewhere..."

She nodds.

"Yep, that's right. And according to Cybertro=
nian lore, only the Autobots are capable of doing the powerlink.  Not the D=
ecepticons or the predacons.  I wonder if this holds true for the Maximals =
as well.. Imagine, if you guys could merge into one formidable warrior.. An=
yway, right now, it's more important that we fight fire with fire.  But it'=
s like Tucson says.  We can't force anyone into anything they don't feel co=
mfortable doing."
